dublinCore.dc:title: 113 S451 IS: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Technical Corrections Act of 2013
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Shelby introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To make technical corrections to the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Technical Corrections Act of 2013.

subsection.text: The table of contents for the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Public Law 111–203; 124 Stat. 1376) is amended by striking the items relating to section 407 through 416 and inserting the following:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 407. Exemption of and reporting by venture capital fund advisers.
Sec. 408. Exemption of and reporting by certain private fund advisers.
Sec. 410. State and Federal responsibilities; asset threshold for Federal registration of investment advisers.
Sec. 412. Comptroller General study on custody rule costs.
Sec. 413. Adjusting the accredited investor standard.
Sec. 414. Rule of construction relating to the Commodity Exchange Act.
Sec. 415. GAO study and report on accredited investors.
Sec. 416. GAO study on self-regulatory organization for private funds.
Sec. 417. Commission study and report on short selling.

subsection.text: Section 2 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5301) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)—

subparagraph.text: by striking section 3 and inserting section 3(w); and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (18)(A)—

subparagraph.text: by striking bank holding company,; and
by inserting includes, before including,.

section.text: Section 6 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5303) is amended, in the second sentence—

paragraph.text: by inserting (15 U.S.C. 12(a)) after Clayton Act; and
by striking Act, to and inserting Act (15 U.S.C. 45) to.

section.text: Title I of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5311 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 102(a)(6) (12 U.S.C. 5311(a)(6)), by inserting (12 U.S.C. 1843(k)) after of 1956 each place that term appears;
in section 111 (12 U.S.C. 5321)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1)(G), by striking Chairperson and inserting Chairman; and
in paragraph (2)(E), by striking such and inserting the; and

paragraph.text: in section 112 (12 U.S.C. 5322)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(2)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (D)—

subclause.text: by striking to monitor and inserting monitor; and
by striking to advise and inserting advise;

clause.text: in subparagraph (J)—
in subparagraph (L), by striking may; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d)(5)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking subsection and and inserting subtitle or; and

paragraph.text: in section 154(c) (12 U.S.C. 5344(c))—

subparagraph.text: by striking Center.— and all that follows through The Research and inserting Center.—The Research; and

paragraph.text: in section 167(b)(1)(B)(ii) (12 U.S.C. 5367(b)(1)(B)(ii)), by striking to ensure and inserting ensure; and
in section 171(b)(4)(D) (12 U.S.C. 5371(b)(4)(D)), by adding a period at the end.

section.text: Title II of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5381 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 210 (12 U.S.C. 5390)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1)(D), by striking wind-up and inserting wind up; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(1)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking to the extent of and all that follows through for each individual and inserting to the extent of $11,725 for each individual; and
in subparagraph (D), by striking multiplied by and all that follows through (as indexed and inserting multiplied by $11,725 (as indexed;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (m)(1)(B), by inserting of before the Bankruptcy Code; and

paragraph.text: in section 211(d)(1)(C) (12 U.S.C. 5391(d)(1)(C)), by striking orderly liquidation plan under section 210(n)(14) and inserting an orderly liquidation plan under section 210(n)(9); and
in section 215(a)(5) (124 Stat. 1518), by striking amd and inserting and.

subsection.text: Title III of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5401 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 333(b)(2) (124 Stat. 1539), by inserting the second place that term appears before and inserting; and
in section 369(5) (124 Stat. 1559)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (D)(i)—

clause.text: in subclause (V), by redesignating items (aa), (bb), and (cc) as subitems (AA), (BB), and (CC), respectively, and adjusting the margins accordingly; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (F)—

clause.text: in clause (ii), by adding and at the end;
in clause (iii), by striking ; and and inserting a period; and
by striking clause (iv); and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (G)(i), by inserting each place such term appears before and inserting.

paragraph.text: The amendment made by subsection (a)(2) of this section shall take effect as though enacted as part of subtitle C of title III of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 1538).

The amendments made by subsection (a)(3) of this section shall take effect as though enacted as part of subtitle E of title III of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 1546).

section.text: Section 414 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 1578) is amended in the section heading by striking Commodities and inserting Commodity.

subsection.text: Title VI of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 1596) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 610 (124 Stat. 1611)—

subparagraph.text: by striking subsection (b); and
by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (b); and

paragraph.text: in section 618(a) (12 U.S.C. 1850a(a))—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (6), by inserting (12 U.S.C. 1841) after Act of 1956.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a)(1) of this section shall take effect as though enacted as part of section 610 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 1611).
Title VII of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (15 U.S.C. 8301 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 719(c)(1)(B) (15 U.S.C. 8307(c)(1)(B)), by adding a period at the end;

in section 723(a)(1)(B) (124 Stat. 1675), by inserting , as added by section 107 of the Commodity Futures Modernization Act of 2000 (Appendix E of Public Law 106–554; 114 Stat. 2763A–382), after subsection (i);
in section 734(b)(1) (124 Stat. 1718), by striking is amended and all that follows through (B) in and inserting is amended in;
in section 741(b)(10) (124 Stat. 1732), by striking 1a(19)(A)(iv)(II) each place it appears and inserting 1a(18)(A)(iv)(II); and
in section 749 (124 Stat. 1746)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)(2), by striking adding at the end and inserting inserting after subsection (f); and
in subsection (h)(1)(B), by inserting the second place that term appears before the semicolon.

subsection.text: The amendments made by paragraphs (3), (4), and (5) of subsection (a) of this section shall take effect as though enacted as part of part II of subtitle A of title VII of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 1658).

section.text: Title VIII of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5461 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 806 (12 U.S.C. 5465)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b), in the first sentence, by striking (2)) after and inserting (2))) after; and
in subsection (e)(1)(A)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d)(1), by adding a period at the end; and

paragraph.text: in section 808(b) (12 U.S.C. 5467(b)), by inserting a comma after under the third place that term appears; and
in section 813 (12 U.S.C. 5472), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting that includes after Representatives.

section.text: Title IX of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 1822) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 929Z(a) (124 Stat. 1871)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking courts interpretation and inserting court interpretations; and

paragraph.text: in section 939(h)(1) (124 Stat. 1887)—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting The before Commission; and
by striking feasability and inserting feasibility; and

paragraph.text: in section 953 (124 Stat. 1903), by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The Commission may, by rule or order, exempt an issuer or class of issuers from the requirements under section 14(i) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (as amended by subsection (a) of this section) or subsection (b) of this section. In determining whether to make an exemption under this subsection, the Commission shall take into account, among other considerations, whether the requirements under subsections (a) and (b) disproportionately burden small issuers.
Title X of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5481 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), in the last sentence by striking 716(c) of title 31, United States Code and inserting 716 of title 31, United States Code; and
in subparagraph (C), by striking section 3709 of the Revised Statutes of the United States (41 U.S.C. 5) and inserting section 6101 of title 41, United States Code;

paragraph.text: in section 1025 (12 U.S.C. 5515)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d), by striking 12 U.S.C. 1867(c) and inserting (12 U.S.C. 1867(c)); and
in subsection (e)(4)(F), by striking 212 of the Federal Credit Union Act (112 U.S.C. 1790a) and inserting 216 of the Federal Credit Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1790d);

paragraph.text: in section 1061 (12 U.S.C. 5581)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(7)—

clause.text: by striking Secretary of the Department of Housing and Urban Development each place that term appears and inserting Department of Housing and Urban Development; and
in subparagraph (A), by striking (12 U.S.C. 5102 et seq.) and inserting (12 U.S.C. 5101 et seq.); and

paragraph.text: in section 1063 (12 U.S.C. 5583)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (f)(1)(B), by striking that; and
in subsection (g)(1)(A)—

clause.text: by striking (12 U.S.C. 5102 et seq.) and inserting (12 U.S.C. 5101 et seq.); and
by striking seq) and inserting seq.);

subparagraph.text: in the paragraph heading, by inserting and education after financial literacy; and
by striking its duties and inserting their duties;

paragraph.text: in section 1076(b)(1) (12 U.S.C. 5602(b)(1)), by inserting before the period at the end the following: , the Bureau may, after notice and opportunity for comment, prescribe regulations;
in section 1084(1) (124 Stat. 2081)—

subparagraph.text: by striking and in 918 and inserting , section 916(d) (15 U.S.C. 1693m(d)), section 918; and
by inserting a comma after 2009);

paragraph.text: by striking section 1087 (124 Stat. 2086);
in section 1089 (124 Stat. 2092)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3)—

paragraph.text: in section 1098(6) (124 Stat. 2104), by inserting the first place that term appears before and.

subsection.text: The amendments made by paragraphs (14), (15), (16), and (17) of subsection (a) of this section shall take effect as though enacted as part of subtitle H of title X of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 2080).

section.text: Title XI of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 2113) is amended, in section 1105(d)(1) (12 U.S.C. 5612(d)(1)), by striking authority.— and all that follows through by the President and inserting authority.—A request by the President.

Title XII of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 2129) is amended, in section 1208(b) (12 U.S.C. 5626(b)), by inserting , as defined in section 103(10) of the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994 (12 U.S.C. 4702(10)), after Fund.
Title XIV of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 2136) is amended, in section 1451(c) (12 U.S.C. 1701x–1(c)), by striking pursuant.

subsection.header: Alternative mortgage transaction parity act of 1982
subsection.text: The Alternative Mortgage Transaction Parity Act of 1982 (12 U.S.C. 3801 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 802(a)(3) (12 U.S.C. 3801(a)(3)), by striking the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision and inserting the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection; and

subparagraph.text: by striking identified and inserting issued; and
by striking the comma after Administration.

paragraph.header: Bank Holding Company Act Amendments of 1970
paragraph.text: Section 106(b)(1) of the Bank Holding Company Act Amendments of 1970 (12 U.S.C. 1972(1)) is amended, in the undesignated matter at the end—

subparagraph.text: by striking “Federal Deposit Insurance Company” and inserting “Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation”.

paragraph.text: Section 13 of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 (12 U.S.C. 1851) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d)(1)(E), by striking 102 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 662) and inserting 103(3) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 (15 U.S.C. 662(3));
in subsection (f)(3)(A)(ii), by striking (d)(1)(g)(v) and inserting (d)(1)(G)(v); and
in subsection (h)(1), by striking section 8 of the International Banking Act of 1978 and inserting section 8(a) of the International Banking Act of 1978 (12 U.S.C. 3106(a)).

subsection.header: Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act
subsection.text: Section 255(g)(1)(A) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (2 U.S.C. 905(g)(1)(A)) is amended by striking Office of Thrift Supervision (20–4108–0–3–373)..
Section 68(a)(1) of the Bretton Woods Agreements Act (22 U.S.C. 286tt(a)(1)) is amended by striking Fund , and inserting Fund,.

Section 7(b)(1)(D) of the CAN–SPAM Act of 2003 (15 U.S.C. 7706(b)(1)(D)) is amended by striking Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision and inserting Comptroller of the Currency or the Board of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, as applicable.

subsection.header: Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998
subsection.text: Section 1306(b)(2) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (15 U.S.C. 6505(b)(2)) is amended by striking Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision and inserting Comptroller of the Currency and the Board of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, as applicable.
The Commodity Exchange Act (7 U.S.C. 1 et seq.) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (12)(A)(i)(II), by adding a semicolon at the end;

in subsection (h)—

clause.text: in paragraph (5)(A)—

subclause.text: by striking Swaps and inserting Each swap; and
by striking no later than 180 days after the effective date of this subsection. and inserting

clause.text: 30 days after the issuance of the interim final rule; or
such other date as the Commission determines appropriate.
in paragraph (7)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (C)(i)(VII), by inserting or a governmental plan after employee benefit plan; and
in subparagraph (D)(ii)(V), by striking of that Act and inserting of that section; and

paragraph.text: in section 4 (7 U.S.C. 6)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(1)(A), by striking commission each place that term appears and inserting Commission; and
in subsection (c)(1)—

in clause (i)—

item.text: in subclause (II), by striking 206(e) and inserting 206; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e)(3)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (B)(i)(II), by striking (11)) and inserting (11))); and
in subparagraph (D)(ii), in the matter preceding subclause (I), by striking non cash collateral and inserting noncash collateral;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (h)—

clause.text: in paragraph (2)(B), by inserting a before swap with; and
in paragraph (5)(A)—

subclause.text: in clause (i)—

item.text: by striking section 1a(18) and inserting section 1a(18)(A); and
in subclause (VII), by striking act of and inserting Act of; and

subclause.text: in clause (ii), by inserting in connection with the transaction after acting; and

in section 5c(c) (7 U.S.C. 7a–2(c))—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (5)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking this subtitle and inserting this Act; and

in paragraph (2)(A)(i), by striking a appropriate and inserting an appropriate; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (f)(3), by striking 7064 and inserting 706.

subsection.text: The Community Reinvestment Act of 1977 (12 U.S.C. 2901 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 803(1)(C) (12 U.S.C. 2902(1)(C)), by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and
in section 806 (12 U.S.C. 2905), by striking companies,, and inserting companies,.

subsection.text: Section 403(4) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (15 U.S.C. 1679a(4)) is amended by striking 103(e) and inserting 103(f).

Section 205(9) of the Depository Institution Management Interlocks Act (12 U.S.C. 3204(9)) is amended by striking Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision and inserting appropriate Federal banking agency.

subsection.header: Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Reduction Act of 1996
subsection.text: Section 2227(a)(1) of the Economic Growth and Regulatory Paperwork Reduction Act of 1996 (12 U.S.C. 252(a)(1)) is amended by striking the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision,.
The Electronic Fund Transfer Act (15 U.S.C. 1693 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 903 (15 U.S.C. 1693a)—
in section 904(a) (15 U.S.C. 1693b(a))—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating the second paragraph designated as paragraph (1) (relating to consultation with other agencies), the second paragraph designated as paragraph (2) (relating to the preparation of an analysis of economic impact), paragraph (3), and paragraph (4), as subparagraphs (A), (B), (C), and (D), respectively, and adjusting the margins accordingly; and
by striking In prescribing such regulations, the Board shall: and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: In prescribing regulations under this subsection, the Bureau and the Board shall—
in section 918(a)(4) (15 U.S.C. 1693o(a)(4), by striking Act and and inserting Act; and; and
in section 920(a)(4)(C) (15 U.S.C. 1693o–2(a)(4)(C)), by striking the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision,.

subsection.text: Section 101(b) of the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 (12 U.S.C. 5211(b)) is amended by striking the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision,.
The Equal Credit Opportunity Act (15 U.S.C. 1691 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 703 (15 U.S.C. 1691b)—

subparagraph.text: in each of subsections (c) and (d), by striking paragraph each place that term appears and inserting subsection; and
in subsection (g), by adding a period at the end;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking Consumer Protection Financial Protection Act of 2010 with and inserting Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010, compliance with; and

paragraph.text: in section 704B(e)(3) (15 U.S.C. 1691c–2(e)(3)), by striking (1)(E) and inserting (2)(E); and
in section 706(k) (15 U.S.C. 1691e(k)), by striking “, (2), or (3)” and inserting “or (2)”.

subsection.text: The Expedited Funds Availability Act (12 U.S.C. 4001 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 605(f)(2)(A) (12 U.S.C. 4004(f)(2)(A)), by striking ,, and inserting a semicolon; and

in section 610(a)(2) (12 U.S.C. 4009(a)(2)), by striking Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision and inserting Comptroller of the Currency and the Board of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, as appropriate,.

subsection.text: The Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 603 (15 U.S.C. 1681a)—
in section 604 (15 U.S.C. 1681b)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(2)(B)(i), by striking section 615(a)(3) and inserting section 615(a)(4); and
in subsection (g)(5), by striking paragraph (2).— and all that follows through The Bureau and inserting paragraph (2).—The Bureau;
by striking shall,, and inserting shall,; and
by striking Commission,, and inserting Commission,;

paragraph.text: in section 609 (15 U.S.C. 1681g)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (c)(1)—

clause.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking commission and inserting bureau; and
in subparagraph (B)(vi), by striking 603(w) and inserting 603(x); and

paragraph.text: in section 612 (15 U.S.C. 1681j)—

subparagraph.text: by striking The Commission each place that term appears and inserting The Bureau; and

paragraph.text: in section 621 (15 U.S.C. 1681s)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (f)(2), by striking The Commission and inserting The Bureau.

subsection.text: Section 206(g)(7)(D)(iv) of the Federal Credit Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1786(g)(7)(D)(iv)) is amended by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting a period.
The Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1811 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 7 (12 U.S.C. 1817)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(2)—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking (D) and inserting (C); and
by redesignating subparagraphs (D) and (E) as subparagraphs (C) and (D), respectively; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e)(2)(C), by adding a period at the end;

paragraph.text: in section 8 (12 U.S.C. 1818)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (t)—

clause.text: in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting a period; and

clause.text: by redesignating the second paragraph designated as paragraph (6), as added by section 1090(1) of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 2093) (relating to referral to the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection), as paragraph (7);

paragraph.text: in section 10(b)(3)(A) (12 U.S.C. 1820(b)(3)(A)), by striking any special examination of any insured depository institution and all that follows and inserting the following: any special examination of any insured depository institution or nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or a bank holding company described in section 165(a) of the Financial Stability Act of 2010, whenever the Board of Directors determines that a special examination of any such depository institution is necessary to determine the condition of such depository institution for insurance purposes, or of such nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors or bank holding company described in section 165(a) of the Financial Stability Act of 2010, for the purpose of implementing its authority to provide for orderly liquidation of any such company under title II of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, provided that such authority may not be used with respect to any such company that is in a generally sound condition.;
in section 11 (12 U.S.C. 1821)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d)(2)(I)(ii), by striking and section 21A(b)(4); and
in subsection (m), in each of paragraphs (16) and (18), by striking the comma after Comptroller of the Currency each place it appears; and

paragraph.text: in section 26(a) (12 U.S.C. 1831c(a)), by striking Holding Company Act each place that term appears and inserting Holding Company Act of 1956.

subsection.header: Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978
subsection.text: Section 1003(1) of the Federal Financial Institutions Examination Council Act of 1978 (12 U.S.C. 3302(1)) is amended by striking the Office of Thrift Supervision,.

subsection.header: Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974
subsection.text: Section 31(a)(5)(B) of the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974 (15 U.S.C. 2227(a)(5)(B)) is amended by striking the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and all that follows through the period and inserting “or the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation under the affordable housing program under section 40 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.”.
The Federal Home Loan Bank Act (12 U.S.C. 1421 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 10(h)(1) (12 U.S.C. 1430(h)(1)), by striking Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision and inserting Comptroller of the Currency or the Board of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, as applicable; and
in section 22(a) (12 U.S.C. 1442(a))—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking Currency and all that follows through Supervision and inserting Currency, the Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, the Chairperson of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, and the Chairman of the National Credit Union Administration; and

in the undesignated matter following paragraph (2), by striking Currency and all that follows through Supervision and inserting Currency, the Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, and the Chairman of the National Credit Union Administration.

subsection.text: The Federal Reserve Act (12 U.S.C. 221 et seq.) is amended in section 11 (12 U.S.C. 248)—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (s), as added by section 1103(b) of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 2118) (relating to Federal Reserve transparency and release of information), as subsection (t); and
in subsection (t), as so redesignated, in paragraph (8)(B), by striking this section and inserting this subsection.

subsection.header: Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989
subsection.text: The Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery, and Enforcement Act of 1989 (Public Law 101–73; 103 Stat. 183) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 1121(6) (12 U.S.C. 3350(6)), by striking the Office of Thrift Supervision,; and
in section 1206(a) (12 U.S.C. 1833b(a)), by striking and the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and inserting the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and.

subsection.text: The Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (Public Law 106–102; 113 Stat. 1338) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking subparagraph (D); and

paragraph.text: in section 522(b)(1)(A)(iv) (15 U.S.C. 6822(b)(1)(A)(iv)), by striking Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision and inserting Comptroller of the Currency and the Board of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, as appropriate.

subsection.header: Helping families save their homes act of 2009
subsection.text: Section 104 of the Helping Families Save Their Homes Act of 2009 (12 U.S.C. 1715z–25) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)—

subparagraph.text: by striking and the Office of Thrift Supervision; and
by striking each such and inserting such; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(1)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A)—

clause.text: in the first sentence—

subclause.text: by striking or the Director;

clause.text: in the second sentence, by striking and the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking and the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision.

subsection.text: The Home Mortgage Disclosure Act of 1975 (12 U.S.C. 2801 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 304(j)(3) (12 U.S.C. 2803(j)(3)), by adding a period at the end; and
in section 305(b)(1)(A)(iii) (12 U.S.C. 2804(b)(1)(A)(iii)), by striking bank as, and inserting bank, as.

subsection.text: The Home Owners' Loan Act (12 U.S.C. 1461 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 5 (12 U.S.C. 1464)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (d)(2)(E)(ii)—

clause.text: in the first sentence, by striking Except as provided in section 21A of the Federal Home Loan Bank Act, the and inserting The; and
by striking , at the Director’s discretion,;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (i)(6), by striking the Office of Thrift Supervision or;
in subsection (n)(9)(B), by striking Director’s and inserting Comptroller’s; and
in subsection (s)—

clause.text: in paragraph (1)—

subclause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking of such Act) and all that follows through shall require and inserting of such Act), the appropriate Federal banking agency shall require; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking other methods and all that follows through determines and inserting other methods as the appropriate Federal banking agency determines;

clause.text: in paragraph (2)—

subclause.text: by striking determined and all that follows through may, consistent and inserting determined by appropriate federal banking agency case-by-case.—The appropriate Federal banking agency may, consistent; and
by striking capital-to-assets and all that follows through determines to be necessary and inserting capital-to-assets as the appropriate Federal banking agency determines to be necessary;

paragraph.text: in section 10 (12 U.S.C. 1467a)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(6), by striking time and all that follows through release and inserting time, upon the motion or application of the Board, release;
in subsection (c)(2)(H)—

clause.text: in the matter preceding clause (i)—

subclause.text: by striking 1841(p)) and inserting 1841(p))); and
by inserting (12 U.S.C. 1843(k)) before if—; and

clause.text: in clause (i), by inserting of 1956 (12 U.S.C. 1843(l) and (m)) after Company Act; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e)(7)(B)(iii)—

clause.text: by striking Board of the Office of Thrift Supervision and inserting Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision; and
by inserting , as defined in section 2 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5301) after transfer date; and

paragraph.text: in section 13 (12 U.S.C. 1468b), by striking the a and inserting a.

subsection.header: Home Ownership and Equity Protection Act of 1994
subsection.text: Section 158 of the Home Ownership and Equity Protection Act of 1994 (15 U.S.C. 1601 note) is amended by striking Bureau each place that term appears and inserting Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection.
Section 502(c)(3) of the Housing Act of 1948 (12 U.S.C. 1701c(c)(3)) is amended by striking Federal Home Loan Bank Agency and inserting Federal Housing Finance Agency.

subsection.header: Housing and Urban Development Act of 1968
subsection.text: Section 106(h)(5) of the Housing and Urban Development Act of 1968 (12 U.S.C. 1701x(h)(5)) is amended by striking authorised and inserting authorized.
Section 15 of the International Banking Act of 1978 (12 U.S.C. 3109) is amended—

paragraph.text: in each of subsections (a) and (b)—

subparagraph.text: by striking , and Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision each place that term appears; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking Comptroller, Corporation, or Director and inserting Comptroller, or Corporation; and
in subsection (c)(4)—

subparagraph.text: by inserting and before the Federal Deposit; and
by striking , and the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision.

subsection.text: Section 912 of the International Lending Supervision Act of 1983 (12 U.S.C. 3911) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (a) In general.—; and
by striking subsection (b).

subsection.header: Interstate land sales full disclosure act
subsection.text: The Interstate Land Sales Full Disclosure Act (15 U.S.C. 1701 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 1402(1) (15 U.S.C. 1701(1)) by striking Bureau of and all that follows through the semicolon at the end and inserting Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection;; and
in each of section 1411(b) (15 U.S.C. 1710(b)) and subsections (b)(4) and (d) of section 1418a (15 U.S.C. 1717a), by striking “Secretary’s” each place that term appears and inserting “Director’s”.

subsection.text: Section 224 of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 (15 U.S.C. 80b–18c) is amended in the section heading, by striking Commodities and inserting Commodity.

subsection.header: Legal Certainty for Bank Products Act of 2000
subsection.text: Section 403(b)(1) of the Legal Certainty for Bank Products Act of 2000 (7 U.S.C. 27a(b)(1)) is amended by striking that section and inserting section.
Section 626(b) of the Omnibus Appropriations Act, 2009 (12 U.S.C. 5538(b)) is amended, in each of paragraphs (2) and (3), by inserting a comma after as appropriate each place that term appears.
Section 111 of Public Law 93–495 (12 U.S.C. 250) is amended by striking the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision,.

subsection.header: Revised Statutes of the United States
subsection.text: Section 5136C(i) of the Revised Statutes of the United States (12 U.S.C. 25b(i)) is amended by striking powers.— and all that follows through In accordance and inserting powers.—In accordance.

subsection.header: Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994
subsection.text: Section 117(e) of the Riegle Community Development and Regulatory Improvement Act of 1994 (12 U.S.C. 4716(e)) is amended by striking the Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision,.

Section 1514 of the S.A.F.E. Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 (12 U.S.C. 5113) is amended in each of subsections (b)(5) and (c)(4)(C), by striking Secretary’s each place that term appears and inserting Director’s.
The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78a et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 15 (15 U.S.C. 78o)—

subparagraph.text: in each of subparagraphs (B)(ii) and (C) of subsection (b)(4), by striking dealer municipal advisor,, and inserting dealer, municipal advisor,;

by redesignating subsections (k) and (l) (relating to standard of conduct and other matters, respectively), as added by section 913(g)(1) of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 1828), as subsections (q) and (r), respectively and moving those subsections to the end; and
in subsection (m), by inserting the before same extent;

paragraph.text: in section 15F(h) (15 U.S.C. 78o–10(h))—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)(A), by inserting “a” after “that acts as an advisor to”;
in paragraph (2)(B), by inserting a after offers to enter into; and
in paragraph (5)(A)(i)—

clause.text: by inserting (A) after (18); and

paragraph.text: in section 15G (15 U.S.C. 78o–11)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e)(4)(C)—

clause.text: by inserting (15 U.S.C. 1639c(b)(2)(A)) after Lending Act; and

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e)(5), by striking subsection and inserting section; and

paragraph.text: in section 17A (15 U.S.C. 78q–1), by redesignating subsection (g), as added by section 929W of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (relating to due diligence for the delivery of dividends, interest, and other valuable property rights) as subsection (n) and moving that subsection to the end.

subsection.header: Telemarketing and consumer fraud and abuse prevention act
subsection.text: Section 3(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act (15 U.S.C. 6102(b)) is amended by inserting before the period at the end the following: , provided, however, nothing in this section shall conflict with or supersede section 6 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (15 U.S.C. 46).
Title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 3132(a)(1)(D), by striking the Office of Thrift Supervision,, the Resolution Trust Corporation,; and
in section 5314, by striking Director of the Office of Thrift Supervision..

subsection.text: Section 987(h)(3) of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking subparagraph (E); and
by redesignating subparagraphs (F) and (G) as subparagraphs (E) and (F), respectively.
Title 31, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking section 309;
in section 313—

clause.text: in subsection (j)(2), by striking Agency; and

subparagraph.text: in section 714(d)(3)(B) by striking a audit and inserting an audit.

paragraph.text: The analysis for subchapter I of chapter 3 of title 31, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 309.

subsection.text: The Truth in Lending Act (15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 103 (15 U.S.C. 1602)—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subsections (aa) and (bb) as subsections (bb) and (aa), respectively, and moving subsection (bb), as so redesignated, after subsection (aa), as so redesignated;

by redesignating the subsection (cc), as added by section 1401 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 2137), as subsection (ee), and by moving such subsection to the end; and

paragraph.text: in section 105 (15 U.S.C. 1604), by inserting subsection (h), as added by section 1472(c) of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (124 Stat. 2187), before subsection (i), as added by section 1100A(7) of that Act (124 Stat. 2108);
in section 129 (15 U.S.C. 1639)—
in section 129C (15 U.S.C. 1639c)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(2)(B), by striking the second period at the end; and

paragraph.text: in section 140A (15 U.S.C. 1651), by striking the Bureau and;
in section 149 (15 U.S.C. 1665d)—

subparagraph.text: by striking National Credit Union Administration Bureau and inserting National Credit Union Administration Board each place that term appears; and
by striking Bureau of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and inserting Board of Directors of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation each place that term appears; and

paragraph.text: in section 181(1) (15 U.S.C. 1667(1)), by striking 103(g) and inserting 103(h).

subsection.text: The Truth in Savings Act (12 U.S.C. 4301 et seq.) is amended in each of sections 269(a)(4) (12 U.S.C. 4308(a)(4)), 270(a)(2) (12 U.S.C. 4309(a)(2)), and 274(6) (12 U.S.C. 4313(6)), by striking Administration Bureau each place that term appears and inserting Administration Board.

The deadline for issuance of any rule or regulation, conduct of any study, or submission of any report required by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Public Law 111–203) or amendments made by that Act that has not been met or is not met in final form by the date specified in that Act or those amendments, shall be extended for 1 year.

The extension provided under subsection (a) shall have no effect on any rule required by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Public Law 111–203) or amendments made by that Act that have been issued in final form before the date of enactment of this Act.

section.text: Except as otherwise specifically provided in this Act—

paragraph.text: the amendments made by this Act to a provision of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Public Law 111–203) shall take effect as if enacted on the effective date of the provision, immediately after the provision takes effect; and

the amendments made by this Act to a provision of law amended by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act shall take effect as if enacted on the effective date of the amendment to that provision of law made by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, immediately after the amendment made by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act takes effect.
